Articles.Content:
I've been having issues landing anything large than my lander can. I've been working on this all morning and can't seem to find a method best suited to launch and land this station. Its pretty balanced longitudinally except for being a bit top-heavy, and even then it is only slightly top-heavy. Any suggestions? I can upload the .cft file if needed. Mods on this station: Kethane (.22), DEMV Mk. V (.21), IonCross (dev 4 for .22), KAS (.22), FusTek, (.21x), B9 (.21). I am also using KW rocketry (.22) if that helps.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Edit: Disregard the first .img.

Edited October 19, 2013 by sharpspoonful

For something huge like that, you may need to put it up in separate launches or launch vertically.

Landing it shouldn't be an issue if it has downward-facing rockets, since gravity is so low on Minmus.
What if i send this to Duna, or the Mun?

When I landed some similar (albeit smaller modules) on the Mun I attached a docking port to the top (of the craft in your picture) that I could attach a skycrane to. Then for balance on launch reasons I stuck the skycrane on top of the whole rocket (on the left of your picture).

Like this:

Then the skycrane attaches to the docking port on the right after the deorbit burn. The ASASs are just there to balance the rover.

Edited October 19, 2013 by boomerdog2000

Ok, so I have lift (I had to use MechJeb, however, because I cannot control it in Kerbin's atmosphere). It's an asparagus-staged 50t launch frame I base most flights on, so I know its reliable. This seems to work in my preliminary testing, but I need to get it into orbit to be 100% sure. Thanks for the help!
